channel.title: How to add npc's
channel.description:
coding on my delta source.
1.I want to mak a new home location can someone tell me how to change it? 2.i want to add npc's there how will i do that? 3.i would like to add 3 shops there how wil i do that? 4.how do i make my teleport tab take me to new home.

how would i do that?

item.title: How to add npc's
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:9, topic:348756”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=445133.msg3268649#msg3268649 date=1279053588]
Home location:
client class (death respawns, commands, portals)
clickingMost class (teleports, portals, teletabs)
Player class (first log in spot)

NPCs: autospawn configuration to spawn, (class5 [client side] to add new NPCs to server)

Shops:
client class (makes NPC open the shops)
shops configuration (holds the data for the shop/items/amounts)
item configuration (holds the data for item prices) [second numerical value]

Teleport tab:
clickingMost or client class.
(depending where the case is stated)
[/quote]Added on: NPC Creating belongs to the Model’s section over at client hacking or w/e it’s called atm.[/quote]

It’s at RuneScape 2 Client Emulation.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

item.cfg

item = #### Name_Of_Item Text when examined Low Alch Value Shop Value High Alch Value The rest are bonuses

item.title: How to add npc's
item.dc:creator: @m_st3r8 m st3r8
item.description:
@m_st3r8 wrote:

you will have to go to autospawn, which may be in the config folder. Then for non moving npc just type in the two coords u want, then leave all the rest as zeros. It will help if theres alredy an example in the folder that you can copy off of. you will learn how to make moving ones later

Read full topic

item.title: How to add npc's
item.dc:creator: @m_st3r8 m st3r8
item.description:
@m_st3r8 wrote:

if the default home location is edgeville, all you have to do is search forwhere you auto respawn, but make sure you search different numbers each time, because the way its set up is:

x+randint(3),y+randint(3)

then youll just have to look for what x and y are. you should only have to try up to 3 numbers because you search for 1 coordinate at a time. also make sure your an admin so yu can check your coords, in my source it ::mypos

if you need help with this, just pm me. (the way i did it was go into my main folder with everything in it, and searched for x a few times (got it on the 3rd try)

Read full topic

item.title: How to add npc's
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

1. buttons or commands? if its buttons, follow answer number 4, if its commands, go to client.java and search the command name, then below there will be either toX toY or triggerTele, and change the coords beside those words to where you want to be teleported

2. autospawn.cfg (config folder) spawn = NPCID x y 0 0 0 0 0 1 oh and change the spaces to that tab key

3. shops.cfg, client.java, autospawn.cfg first go to client.java and search for wanneshop, copy one code that looks like this:

if(NPCID == 2537){ PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 5; }
then change the 2537 in the first line to your shop owner NPCID, change the 5 in the 3rd line to 50
Now go to autospawn.cfg, make another line at the end (follow answer 2 to know how) but change the NPCID Number to the same number you put in the wanneshop thing in line 1
And finally, go to shops.cfg, go to the end and copy one of the lines, change the shop = # into 50 because we put wanneshop as 50
then change the name, put underneath -----sell---- a number 2 and same underneath buy.
Finally, add the Item Ids, and Item Amount, Item Id’s, item amount.

4. clickingmost.java (search the coords of where your teleported, search them and modify them)

[size=14pt]if you dont understand then just post it becuz i wrote this in 3 minutes[/size]

Read full topic
